name: Stonecore Quarry
description: Stone walls rise high, cut not just by hand but by something older. The quarry's base is littered with rusted tools and half-formed statues. Dust lingers in the still air — not wind, but memory.

story_actions.story_text: A quarry worker waves as you step in. 'About time! We’re fine — just cut off. The flood didn’t reach us, but it rattled everything up top.'
Shift rubble and re-align support beams near the damaged lift shaft. The crew works alongside you, grateful for the extra hands.
You and the crew rig the lift back together using scavenged nails and stone. It shudders, then steadies — ready to descend once more.
The lift lowers you into the main pit. Stone walls loom around you, carved with clean lines and quarry marks. Crew voices echo faintly through the tunnels.
You help load carts with quarried stone and assist the crew in guiding them to the surface. The lift groans with each load.
You redistribute salvaged nails and reinforce tool racks. The workers nod in approval — small things matter in keeping pace.
With stone hauled and the lift steady, you arrange the first outbound shipment. A crewmember grins. 'Hillstead’s going to feel this one.'
Decipher the glyphs. They seem to align with memories — not your own, but familiar nonetheless.
Approach the Stone Core — a crystalline monolith vibrating softly. It pulses in rhythm with your breath.
Choose to amplify the stone, sealing part of your memory into it.
Choose to leave the stone untouched, sensing that it may awaken on its own later...
Depart the quarry. The wind carries a voice that murmurs your name — or perhaps a future version of it.

The crew gathers as the final shipment is loaded. 'Feels like we're back in rhythm,' one says, clapping dust from his gloves. Another nods toward you. 'Couldn’t have done it without the help.' The quarry hums with purpose once more.
